title: CSE Engineer, Systems
description:
Certified as a Top Employer; KONE is dedicated to a better world of work and exhibits this through excellent people practices. We are committed to fostering a great work culture and inspiring the highest standards of quality and efficiency putting our people first and creating a workplace that nurtures collaboration, diversity, growth and wellbeing.
It's time to make a move. Join our flow.
We have an exciting opportunity for an energetic and enthusiastic CSE Engineer, System who provides technical expertise on how to optimally integrate KONE solutions into customer building interfaces. Building interfaces are, on-site (in-building): mechanical, electrical and software. Non-site-related interfaces are: related to cloud-, mobile- and third-party equipment interfaces. He/she understands how customer needs are translated into system integration needs and/or opportunities.
What will you do?
Collaboration with sales:
Responsible for finding the optimal building integration capability to meet the customer’s needs for non-standard and modernisation cases
Responsible for designing electrical, software and APF Solution interfaces (e.g. cloud integrations, network, IoT and data interfaces)
Participates in customer meetings and answers customers’ technical questions when needed
Selects the correct integration platform on which to make the offering
Proposes solutions from all KONE business lines; new services, escalators, elevators, doors etc.
System integration plan – Costing:
Involves Advance People Flow (DCS, Access Control and other people flow integration), KONE IT, R&D, sourcing and other relevant parties to understand the integration total cost during setting up and during operation
Coordinates building integration lead times for Advanced People Flow, KONE IT, R&D, local sourcing and other relevant parties
Solution plan – Compliance:
Ensures that the proposed system integration fulfils local codes, regulations and safety requirements
Ensures that the proposed system integration solution fulfils connectivity, network architecture, access control systems, IoT and cyber security requirements
Ensures that the planned system integration complies with KONE engineering policy
Provides the required details to the CSE Specialist for ordering materials and completing the documentation process
Proposes change order (variations and add works) sales opportunities to the Project Manager
Provides system integration-related information to Project Managers, Installation Supervisors and Maintenance Supervisors
Coordinates and executes the integration testing
Solution plan – Maintainability:
Ensures that the proposed system integration method fulfils the customer’s product lifecycle needs
Identifies deviations from standard maintenance methods and ensures that a resolution is found
CSE Engineer, System role in the KONE SEB process :
Shares knowledge with maintenance as needed
Participates in major system upgrades verification and validations
General responsibilities:
Participates in product and new services release information-sharing sessions
Provides technical trainings to Sales, Installation and Maintenance as per Front Line needs
Provides input to CSE Engineer, Solution; CSE Engineer, Product and CSE Engineer, Project
Provides details and definitions to CSE Specialists
Offers input to the product offering management about interface requirements for the portfolio
Contributes to the Customer Solutions Engineering virtual and local network
Contributes to and utilises the Customer Solutions Engineering case library
Is the primary FL contact person for KONE IT, SL and Advance People flow for system integrations
Are you the one?
Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Electronics and Communication Systems and Information Technology or another relevant field, or 5 to 6 years’ experience in the integrations/connectivity field of operations
Experience of building automation system(s) design and configuration
Experience in integrating with the Internet of Things
Excellent communication and influencing skills in English
Basics of ITIL (foundation) or another equivalent.
Basics of test management
Holistic understanding of the building automation systems and protocols
Holistic understanding of building integration capabilities
Good knowledge of IoT
Good knowledge of system/application integrations and APIs
Excellent skills in understanding and translating customer needs (requirements) into system integration specifications
Good solution and value-selling skills
Basic knowledge of KONE solution-related norms and standards
Basic knowledge of environmental and sustainability requirements and norms
Basic understanding of local norms and regulations
Excellent knowledge of connectivity, network architecture, access control systems, IoT and cyber security
VB Specific knowledge: Conducting site surveys for integration-specific needs, existing building modernization/installation methods.
At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of each individual. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life.

Kone

title: Site Reliability Engineer - Master Data Governance
description:
Department: Data & Automation, Digital & Technology Platform Services.
Location: Egypt, Cairo.
As a Site Reliability Engineer - Master Data Governance, you will play a critical role in ensuring the reliability, scalability, automations and performance of our Data Governance production systems. You will work closely with our development and operations teams to build and maintain products, improve system reliability, and develop automated solutions to address operational challenges. Your role will involve optimizing platform efficiency, driving faster troubleshooting, and minimizing downtime to deliver superior business outcomes and customer experiences.
YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Proactive Improvements: Proactively analyze incident patterns to provide diagnostic insights, helping to identify problems in the area of Data Governance and driving their resolution in collaboration with product team.
Complex Problem Troubleshooting: Lead troubleshooting efforts for complex issues in collaboration with application support partners, including proactive management of alerts and participation in crisis management teams as required, regardless of working hours.
Operational Excellence: Influence and collaborate with Data Governance product teams to prioritize and swiftly implement user stories focused on operational improvements.
Automation: Identify and implement automation opportunities to enhance operational efficiency across all tasks. Collaborate with Cyber Security team for improving security measures.
Observability Utilization: Use observability toolbox such as Dynatrace, ServiceNow, Azure Monitor, AquaSec, or SAP MDG Inbound/Outbound monitoring tools to identify and implement product improvements and automations aimed at enhancing incident resolution, product performance, and availability.
Collaboration: Collaborate with architects, DevOps, and Applications Support engineers to find solutions that improve product stability and reduce incidents with proactive, long-term approach. Participate in DevOps routines contributing to problem identification and implementation of improvements.
SRE Community Engagement: Work with Central SRE, SIAM manager, and the SRE Community of Practice to leverage synergies and share best practices.
ARE THESE YOUR SECRET INGREDIENTS?
University Bachelor or Master's degree in IT, Engineering, Computer Science.
Proven experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or similar role.
5+ years of professional experience in complex IT landscape and full stack technologies - mobile and web applications, Cloud (Azure, AWS, Google), OS, database, storage, virtualization, network.
2-5 years of experience in developing/maintaining Master Data objects within SAP applications (SAP MDG, S/4 HANA. SAP BPM, SAP MDM).
Hands-on experience with BP (Customer, Supplier, Contact Person) Objects in either of the two SAP systems - SAP MDG or S/4 HANA.
Proven experience in building end-to-end solutions, from requirement gathering to deployment.
Experience integrating SAP MDG with enterprise systems like MS Dynamics365, S/4 HANA, SAP CRM.
Strong proficiency in configuration, deployment, troubleshooting and supporting SAP MDG application with various customizations.
Experience with SAP MDG and S/4 HANA background jobs monitoring and troubleshooting.
Familiarity with reusable components, workflows, and libraries.
Strong expertise in automation, monitoring, and performance tuning in SAP landscape.
ITIL certification will be considered as an advantage.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure during incident resolution.
Fluent in written and verbal English.
ABOUT YOUR NEW TEAM:
We are Coca-Cola Hellenic, a growth-focused consumer goods business and strategic bottling partner of the Coca-Cola Company. We bottle, distribute and sell an unrivalled range of products in 29 markets in Europe, Africa and Eurasia. As we do, we create value for all stakeholders, support socio-economic growth and build a more positive environmental impact.
We bring together more than 30,000 people from over 70 nationalities, coming from five continents. The diversity of our markets, from mature to emerging economies, provides a wide range of attractive opportunities for growth.
We nurture our talents. We give opportunities to people across all functions and levels, as well as different geographies, backgrounds and education. We are willing to take a risk on the people we believe in, even if they don't have the perfect experience. We have faith in what every person can be.
And although we have so much to be proud of, we always stay humble. We believe the real magic happens - for us and for you - when we OPEN UP.
AT COCA-COLA HBC, DIVERSITY HELPS US THRIVE
At Coca-Cola HBC, we are an inclusive employer that thrives on diversity. This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.
Brands
Coca-Cola HBC

title: Systems Engineer (SecOps) - Egypt
description:
Job Description:
Systems Engineer (SecOps)
Location: Cairo, Egypt
Our Team
The Fortinet Systems Engineering team is a group of technically skilled and commercially astute professionals who are passionate about solving our customers' challenges through the delivery of industry-leading Cybersecurity solutions.
We are looking for a Systems Engineer working in a dedicated SecOps Team, mainly with our sales representatives on SecOps opportunities and as well with the channel representatives to grow the Fortinet SecOps partner landscape across the region. The SecOps Systems Engineer's main mission will be to support the sales, presales and channel organization in all SecOps technical matters regarding PoC's, pre-sales, sales calls and post-sales.
Key Responsibilities:
Build advisory relationships with customers focusing on Fortinet SecOps solutions.
Support customers and partners alongside sales through the entire opportunity lifecycle from the initial RFIs through to RFPs & RFQs when required.
Be the primary technical point of contact for the customer(s) and partners in close collaboration with your sales partner.
Continuously strive to improve knowledge around the Fortinet products and solutions, along with maintaining a deep understanding of the competitive landscape and Fortinet's ability to provide long-lasting protection against the ever-evolving threats.
Oversee and conduct demonstrations of the solutions, ensuring Fortinet's offerings are well positioned against competitors.
Customize solutions to meet complex customer requirements, emphasizing the integration of Fortinet components for seamless security strength.
Manage your time effectively when working on multiple deals simultaneously, ensuring a positive customer experience is maintained.
Experience/ skills:
Deep experience in technical/pre-sales support, preferably at a security vendor or SecOps vendor.
BSC, or equivalent and 5+ years of experience with technical SE / SA and SOC.
Strong understanding in concepts of mitigating attack vectors and defence in depth.
Strong knowledge and comfortable with high degree of activities in API scripting, Python, Golang, Shell scripting.
Strong knowledge of Security Operation Centre workflow, Incident Analysis, and Incident Handling approach.
Excellent Knowledge and Technical hands on the following SecOps technologies: SIEM, SOAR, EDR, Deception, Sandboxing and NDR.
Experience in cyber security for operational technology environments. An excellent understanding of the risks and opportunities.
Experience in building business with customers and partners.
Excellent presentation skills.
Fluency in English.
Fortinet

title: Senior Hybrid Cloud Engineer
description:
Department: Enabling Technology, Digital & Technology Platform Services.
Location: Egypt, Cairo.
The Hybrid Cloud Engineer, ensure seamless integration between on-premises VMware and Microsoft Windows-based infrastructure with cloud and Citrix technologies. The role will focus not only on infrastructure management but also on driving efficiency through automation, robust backup & DR strategies, and licensing management. To support the business's goals, this role emphasizes cost optimization, performance tuning, and delivering solutions aligned with compliance and security requirements. Given the increasing importance of disaster recovery and backup as organizations face rising risks of cyber-attacks and data breaches, this role also leads the development and monitoring of efficient backup solutions, ensuring business continuity and quick recovery in case of disaster.
YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design and Implement Hybrid Cloud Solutions: Collaborate with stakeholders to design hybrid cloud solutions (on-premises and cloud-based) that meet the business's technical and operational needs, particularly leveraging VMware and Microsoft Windows & SQL Server technologies.
Infrastructure Management: Deploy and maintain infrastructure using automation and management tools like vSphere, vCenter, ARIA, SCCM, Azure Arc, PowerShell, etc. Ensure efficient performance, scalability, and high availability across hybrid cloud platforms for Windows Server, and SQL workloads.
Security and Compliance: Implement and maintain security protocols that comply with industry standards (e.g., GDPR, ISO). Ensure infrastructure security while keeping up with best practices and CCH requirements.
License Management and Compliance: Proactively manage software licensing for VMware, Microsoft Windows, SQL or other DB technology, and Backup environments. Oversee compliance, ensuring renewals are handled efficiently, and work to optimize licensing costs through effective planning.
Budgeting and Cost Optimization: Work with the finance and procurement teams to forecast and plan budgets related to hybrid cloud infrastructure. Provide cost estimates for projects and actively seek ways to optimize infrastructure costs, while maintaining performance.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams (DevOps, product, Cyber Security, Network) to ensure alignment in strategies and operations. Document and communicate technical designs, processes, and decisions effectively.
Continuous Monitoring and Optimization: Monitor the performance of hybrid cloud environments and identify areas for optimization. This includes ensuring SQL databases are running efficiently and the VMware infrastructure is optimized for workloads.
Design and Implement Backup & DR Solutions: Develop and maintain backup and disaster recovery solutions, primarily using technologies such as Veeam or other industry-standard tools. Ensure the backup strategy is aligned with the organization's business continuity and data retention requirements.
Backup Monitoring and Optimization: Regularly monitor backup performance and success rates, troubleshoot issues, and optimize the backup processes to ensure minimal disruption and fast recovery times. Ensure data integrity and availability across hybrid environments.
ARE THESE YOUR SECRET INGREDIENTS?
1. Hybrid Cloud Architecture & Integration
Expertise in VMware, Microsoft Windows Server, and Azure Arc integration.
Ability to implement, manage, and troubleshoot hybrid cloud environments.
2. Automation of operational tasks
Hands-on experience with PowerShell, SCCM, and Azure Arc.
Automating deployments, configurations, and monitoring for hybrid cloud efficiency.
3. Virtualization
Strong experience in VMware vSphere, vCenter, and Citrix DaaS/Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD).
Ensuring scalability, high availability, and performance across virtualized environments.
4. Backup & Disaster Recovery (DR)
Expertise in Veeam or other backup solutions for hybrid cloud.
Ensuring compliance with data retention and business continuity strategies.
5. Security & Compliance
Knowledge of regulatory frameworks (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001, ITIL).
Experience in implementing access controls, identity management, and security monitoring.
6. Software Licensing & Cost Management
Managing VMware, Microsoft Windows, SQL, and backup software licenses.
Optimizing costs through forecasting, audits, and vendor negotiations.
7. Performance Monitoring & Optimization
Using tools like Dynatrace, vRealize, and Azure Monitor to track and improve performance.
Identifying and resolving hybrid cloud bottlenecks proactively.
8. Collaboration & Communication
English fluency verbal and written communication is a MUST.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams (Architects, SREs, Security, Network).
Strong documentation skills for technical designs and reports.
9. Incident Management & Problem-Solving
Ability to diagnose and resolve hybrid cloud performance and security issues.
Leading root cause analysis and continuous improvement initiatives.
10. Strategic Thinking & Initiative
Ownership of hybrid cloud tasks with minimal vendor reliance.
Proactively identifying and implementing process improvements.
ABOUT YOUR NEW TEAM:
We are Coca-Cola Hellenic, a growth-focused consumer goods business and strategic bottling partner of the Coca-Cola Company. We bottle, distribute and sell an unrivalled range of products in 29 markets in Europe, Africa and Eurasia. As we do, we create value for all stakeholders, support socio-economic growth and build a more positive environmental impact.
We bring together more than 30,000 people from over 70 nationalities, coming from five continents. The diversity of our markets, from mature to emerging economies, provides a wide range of attractive opportunities for growth.

title: Hybrid Cloud Engineer
description:
Department: Enabling Technology, Digital & Technology Platform Services.
Location: Egypt, Cairo.
The Hybrid Cloud Engineer supports the integration between on-premises VMware and Microsoft Windows-based infrastructure with cloud technologies. This role focuses on assisting with infrastructure management, improving efficiency through automation, and supporting backup and disaster recovery strategies.
YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Implement Hybrid Cloud Solutions: Assist in implementing hybrid cloud solutions based on established designs (on-premises and cloud-based) that meet the business's technical and operational needs, particularly leveraging VMware and Microsoft Windows & SQL Server technologies.
Infrastructure Support: Deploy and maintain infrastructure using automation and management tools like vSphere, vCenter, ARIA, SCCM, Azure Arc, PowerShell, etc. Ensure efficient performance, scalability, and high availability across hybrid cloud platforms for Windows Server, and SQL workloads.
Deploy and maintain the Citrix DaaS/Azure Virtual Desktop environment, ensuring efficient performance, scalability, and high availability across regions.
Security and Compliance: Implement and maintain security protocols that comply with industry standards (e.g., GDPR, ISO). Ensure infrastructure security while keeping up with best practices and CCH requirements.
License Management and Compliance: Proactively manage software licensing for VMware, Microsoft Windows, SQL or other DB technology, and Backup environments. Handle efficiently compliance and renewals to optimize licensing costs.
Budgeting and Cost Optimization: Provide input to help forecast and plan budgets related to hybrid cloud infrastructure. Provide cost estimates for projects and actively seek ways to optimize infrastructure costs, while maintaining performance.
Collaboration and Communication: Assist cross-functional teams (DevOps, product, Cyber Security, Network) to ensure alignment in strategies and operations. Document and communicate technical designs, processes, and decisions effectively.
Monitoring and Optimization: Ensure the good performance of hybrid cloud environments and identify areas for optimization.
Design and Implement Backup & DR Solutions: Develop and maintain backup and disaster recovery solutions, primarily using technologies such as Veeam or other industry-standard tools. Comply with the backup strategy and fulfil the organization's business continuity and data retention requirements.
Backup Monitoring and Optimization: Regularly monitor backup performance and success rates, troubleshoot issues, and optimize the backup processes to ensure minimal disruption and fast recovery times. Ensure data integrity and availability across hybrid environments.
ARE THESE YOUR SECRET INGREDIENTS?
1. Hybrid Cloud Infrastructure Management
Strong experience in managing VMware, Windows Server, and Azure-based hybrid cloud environments.
Ability to deploy, configure, and troubleshoot hybrid cloud infrastructure with minimal supervision.
2. Infrastructure Deployment & Optimization
Hands-on experience with VMware vSphere, vCenter, and Azure Arc for hybrid cloud management.
Skilled in configuring and optimizing Windows Server, SQL Server, and virtualized environments.
3. Automation of operational tasks
Proficiency in PowerShell for scripting and automation.
Familiarity with Ansible, SCCM or Azure Arc to automate deployments and configurations.
4. Backup & Disaster Recovery (DR) Implementation
Practical experience in configuring and maintaining Veeam or similar backup solutions.
Ability to design and implement DR solutions in hybrid environments.
5. Security & Compliance Implementation
Strong knowledge of identity management, access controls, and hybrid security frameworks.
Ability to implement and maintain security best practices to align with GDPR, ISO 27001.
6. Software Licensing & Cost Management
Proficient in managing and optimizing Microsoft, VMware, and SQL licensing.
Ability to forecast and optimize infrastructure costs while maintaining compliance.
7. Performance Monitoring & Troubleshooting
Experience using monitoring tools (e.g., Dynatrace, vRealize, Azure Monitor) to optimize system performance.
Ability to identify, diagnose, and resolve performance bottlenecks across hybrid cloud platforms.
8. Cross-Team Collaboration & Communication
English fluency verbal and written communication is a MUST.
Works closely with Architects, SREs, and Security teams to align infrastructure strategies.
Ability to document and maintain documentation for technical solutions.
9. Incident Management & Problem-Solving
Strong troubleshooting skills for hybrid cloud failures, performance issues, and security incidents.
Experience identifying root cause analysis and continuous improvement initiatives.
10. Initiative & Leadership Potential
Takes ownership of tasks and drives them to completion with minimal oversight.
Proactively identifies areas for improvement and suggests automation or optimization strategies

title: Intelligent Controls & Automation Sr. Manager
description:
Job Location ALEXANDRIA PLANT
Job Description
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Intelligent Controls and Automation Engineer to join our site engineering team! This role is pivotal in running and advancing our control systems, focusing on Siemens and Rockwell automation platforms. The successful candidate will be based in Alexandria, Louisiana, with a requirement to be working at the Alexandria Plant facility and occasional travel for vendor acceptance testing and project support.
As the Intelligent Controls and Automation Engineer you will:
Provide technical leadership in supporting the OU core business and initiative delivery.
Act as a key enabler in leading and delivering results against challenges.
Be an integral part of completing projects for the category by using new advanced controls, robotics, information systems and Cyber Security technologies.
Job Qualifications
Required
Bachelor or Master's degree in and Engineering
Ability to travel 10%-25% of the time
Willing to relocate throughout the career
5+ years of experience
Key Responsibilities
Design, develop, and implement control systems for molding, assembly, and packaging equipment.
Handle electrical schematics, programming, and safety validation plans.
Lead the design and architecture of control systems, ensuring compliance with NEC, NFPA, ISO standards.
Troubleshoot and debug control systems, providing technical support for commissioning efforts.
Participate in daily direction setting meetings, department meetings, and platform-specific meetings.
Communicate effectively with technical representatives and broader teams to ensure project alignment and progress.
Support obsolescence management and update existing control systems as needed.
Compensation for roles at P&G varies depending on a wide array of non-discriminatory factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, degree/credentials, relevant skills, and level of relevant experience. At P&G compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Total rewards at P&G include salary + bonus (if applicable) + benefits. Your recruiter may be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the hiring process.
We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Immigration Sponsorship is not available for this role. For more information regarding who is eligible for hire at P&G along with other work authorization FAQ’s, please click !
Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law.
Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Job Schedule Full time
Job Number R000126138
Job Segmentation Experienced Professionals (Job Segmentation)
Starting Pay / Salary Range $105,000.00 - $156,000.00 / year
Procter & Gamble

title: Deloitte Innovation Hub I Senior Android mobile Developer, Cairo, Egypt
description:
Location
Cairo, Egypt Delivery Center
Senior Android Mobile Developer, Cairo, Egypt
Connect to your career at Deloitte.
Deloitte, established globally in 1845, is the world's largest and leading professional services firm, providing Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal and Consulting and related services to public and private clients spanning multiple industries. Present in more than 150 countries, Deloitte is distinct in its ability to help clients solve their most complex problems, from strategy to implementation.
Deloitte innovation hub (DIH) is a strategic initiative established by Deloitte North & South Europe (NSE) to support our ambition to become the leading business transformation partner of choice for our clients and to expand and scale our delivery footprint across EMEA. With access to a scaled, diverse, highly skilled, motivated, and engaged workforce, DIH is delivering complex technical solutions for clients' most complex business problems, across portfolios that include 'Strategy & Transactions', 'Customer', 'Engineering, AI & Data, 'Enterprise, Technology & Performance' and 'Cyber'. DIH is aiming to become the destination for top talents in Egypt for a long, exciting career.
We invest in outstanding people of diverse talents and backgrounds and empower them to achieve more than they could elsewhere. Our work combines advice with action and integrity. We believe that when our clients and society are stronger, so are we. Our organization has grown in scale and diversity, providing services across the region, with our shared culture remaining the same. We aim to help clients realize their ambitions, make a positive difference in society, and maximize the success of our people. This drive fuels the commitment and humanity that run deep through our every action.
Connect to your opportunity.
This is an expert software engineer and leader role with knowledge of Continuous Delivery and industry leading practices used in creating scalable, highly resilient solutions.
Native Mobile Development in Android (Kotlin 2+ years and Java)
Knowledge and experience to support and migrate older Java Android code
Knowledge of common design patterns such as MVVM, loC, MVP
Functional and object oriented design patterns including DDD.
Knowledge of accessibility needs and how to solve for them.
Monitoring and fixing performance issues.
Designing secure applications and fixing security issues.
Automated functional testing.
Architecture Design: Design scalable and maintainable application architectures, ensuring efficient implementation of architectural patterns.
Leadership: Leading design decisions, establishing the engineering approach used by the team, coaching and guiding other software engineers.
Liaising with external stakeholders such as engineers in other teams, architects or infrastructure teams.
Explaining complex technical issues with key stakeholders with a non-technical background. Version Control and Collaboration: Utilize version control systems like Git for collaborative development, ensuring code quality and smooth integration of features from multiple team members.
Agile development methods: Follow Test Drive Development as a professional discipline to create software. Comfortable doing pair programming.
Testing: Working knowledge of modern testing tools.
Test driven development for Android.
Behaviour-driven development/Specification by example
DevOps: Practical experience in Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery.
Security Considerations: Implement security best practices, including data encryption, user authentication, and authorization mechanisms, to safeguard the application from potential threats.
Performance Optimization: Analyse and optimize application performance, identifying bottlenecks and implementing strategies to enhance speed and responsiveness.
Client Interaction: Collaborate closely with clients and stakeholders to gather requirements, provide updates, and address feedback, demonstrating strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Other useful experience:
Microservice Architectures.
Comfortable with VIPER (to make changes).
Knowledge of multiple Architectures and when to use them.
Deploying to the cloud infrastructure Kubernetes and Google cloud platform.
Knowledge of the OWASP Top Ten Gitlab CI, Bitrise CI
Connect to your skills and professional experience.
3 to 6 years of experiences.
Mobile Development experience - Android -: Undertake end-to-end Android mobile development from requirement analysis and design to implementation and deployment.
Containers: Experience with Docker and Kubernetes.
Version Control: Competence in using Git for version control, branching, and collaborating effectively with other team members on codebases.
Basic DevOps Skills: Experience with basic deployment practices.
Cloud experience: Experience with GCP.
Debugging and Troubleshooting: Skill in identifying and resolving bugs, errors, and performance issues across the entire application stack.
Continuous Learning: Demonstrated commitment to staying updated with industry trends and learning new technologies through online courses, coding communities, and self-driven projects.
Connect to your service line - Technology & Transformation
Distinctive thinking, deep expertise, and collaborative working. That's what connects us. That's what makes us Deloitte. If you want to help solve some of the biggest challenges around, join us. Together, we'll make an impact that matters.
Connect to your Industry.
“What attracted me to Deloitte were the endless opportunities and the collective experience of other like-minded individuals. Deloitte's clients include many of the world's largest organisations; I wanted to be part of a team that made a difference that I could be proud of.”
-Dan, Technology and Transformation
Our commitment to you
Making an impact is more than just what we do: it's why we're here. So we work hard to create an environment where you can experience a purpose you believe in, the freedom to be you, and the capacity to go further than ever before.
We want you. The true you. Your own strengths, perspective and personality. So we're nurturing a culture where everyone belongs, feels supported and heard, and is empowered to make a valuable, personal contribution. You can be sure we'll take your wellbeing seriously, too. Because it's only when you're comfortable and at your best that you can make the kind of impact you, and we, live for.
Your expertise is our capability, so we'll make sure it never stops growing. Whether it's from the complex work you do, or the people you collaborate with, you'll learn every day. Through world-class development, you'll gain invaluable technical and personal skills. Whatever your level, you'll learn how to lead.
Connect to your next step
A career at Deloitte is an opportunity to develop in any direction you choose. Join us and you'll experience a purpose you can believe in and an impact you can see. You'll be free to bring your true self to work every day. And you'll never stop growing, whatever your level.
Discover more reasons to connect with us, our people and purpose-driven culture at Deloitte middle east careers.
Deloitte

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
Senior Solutions Architect
Sales Cairo, Greater Cairo
Description
It's an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of Inc. magazine's Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are inherently simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500 and 93 of the Fortune 100, and our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies-and having fun along the way.
We are looking for a Senior Solutions Architect in Egypt to join our MEA sales team, reporting to the manager of the region's Solution Architects team. In this role, the main focus is working closely with our world-class sales team to overcome and remove all technical barriers in the sales process. This trusted technical advisor will help the sales team develop new business by working directly with customers and partners, effectively positioning Infoblox solutions.
You're the ideal candidate if you are a strategic thinker with a strong networking and security background, understand complex SaaS selling, work well independently, and are results-driven.
What you'll do:
Build business cases and technical differentiation in sales opportunities by educating customers and partners about Infoblox solution
Develop pre-sales engineering content-presentations, demos, and webinars-on Infoblox solutions for customer and partner audiences
Design solutions and architectural diagrams that convey proposed Infoblox solutions, how they will be engineered, and how they will integrate with other vendors
Educate partner technical sales teams about Infoblox solutions and technologies and when/how they can identify opportunities and position Infoblox solutions to customers
Work closely with your primary account manager and support the rest of the team in your areas of core competency
Evaluate and identify new opportunities within existing accounts to expand with more Infoblox solutions
What you'll bring:
Experience in Cloud/Security space with working knowledge of design and implementation for at least one of the following: AWS, Azure, VMWare, Kubernetes, or HBSS, Nextgen Firewalls, TIPS, IPS/IDS, DevOps
3+ years of experience supporting technical sales or 5+ years of experience in engineering or operations networking
3+ years of experience in networking technologies, including TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, LAN/WAN, Routing, Switching, Firewalls, IPv4/v6, UNIX Admin, and experience with switches, routers, and firewalls in Intranet/Internet/Extranet environments
Strong knowledge of general security best practices and direct experience with at least one security product
Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technology simply
Strong network in Egypt as a focus area for this role
Ability to work in the field frequently; 70% travel is required
Conscientious attitude and dependability, self-starter, ability to work independently while appreciating teamwork and communication
DDI -- DNS/DHCP/IPAM experience
CCSP, CISSP, CASP+, CySA+ CEH technical certifications a plus
Bachelor's Degree
Fluency in English and Arabic
What success looks like:
After six months, you will…
Have a foundational knowledge of our entire product/solution portfolio
Demonstrate fluency with either on-prem or SaaS-based Infoblox solutions
Identify 1-2 specialization areas
Capable of handling primary SA customer-facing tasks with only occasional help from others
After about a year, you will…
Demonstrate fluency with all Infoblox solutions
Capable of handling advanced SA customer-facing tasks with only occasional help from others
Able to conduct POCs & customer demos with little to no supervision
Go-to person for specialization area for assigned region
We've got you covered:
Our holistic package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness-as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and generous paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our every day-we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers.
Why Infoblox?
We've created a culture that embraces and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you're a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out . We think you'll be excited to join our team
Infoblox
